DataElement.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Clinical Benefits Prediction Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on prediction of clinical benefits from specific treatments.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Clinical Benefits Prediction
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Molecular; relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._An analysis (often in graphical form) representing the extent to which something exhibits various characteristics._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._The positive effects of something._An extrapolation of given data into the future.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
An analysis (often in graphical form) representing the extent to which something exhibits various characteristics.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

To be influenced by or changed.
:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: To be influenced by or changed.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.

A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
